Package eu.opends.environment

Class TrafficLight

java.lang.Object
eu.opends.environment.TrafficLight
public class TrafficLight
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents a single traffic light which can be switched between different states. A traffic light may be equipped with arrow lights or just with a circular light.
Author:
Rafael Math

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  TrafficLight.TrafficLightDirection
    TrafficLightDirection indicates whether the the traffic light has arrow-shaped lights and to which direction they are pointing.
    static class  TrafficLight.TrafficLightState
    TrafficLightState indicates the combination of illuminated lights.

      public TrafficLight.TrafficLightState getState()
      Returns the traffic light state, e.g. TrafficLightState.RED
      Returns:
      traffic light state

    • setState

      public void setState​(TrafficLight.TrafficLightState state)
      Changes the traffic light state immediately to the given value (e.g. TrafficLightState.RED) by loading the corresponding texture file for the traffic light.
      Parameters:
      state - state to change to immediately

    • getDirection

      public TrafficLight.TrafficLightDirection getDirection()
      Returns the traffic light direction, e.g. TrafficLightDirection.RIGHT
      Returns:
      traffic light direction

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection​(TrafficLight.TrafficLightDirection direction)
      Changes the traffic light direction immediately to the given value (e.g. TrafficLightDirection.RIGHT) by loading the corresponding texture file for the traffic light.
      Parameters:
      direction - direction to change to immediately

    • getTrafficLightRules

      public java.util.ArrayList<TrafficLight> getTrafficLightRules()
      Returns a list of traffic lights which have to be red before the current traffic light may be switched to green
      Returns:
      List of traffic lights that are required to be red

    • getPositionData

      public TrafficLightPositionData getPositionData()
      Returns the traffic light position data
      Returns:
      traffic light position data

      public void setPositionData​(TrafficLightPositionData positionData)
      Sets the traffic light position data
      Parameters:
      positionData - traffic light position data

    • getPhasePosition

      public int getPhasePosition()

    • getTrafficLightInternalProgram

      public TrafficLightInternalProgram getTrafficLightInternalProgram()
      Getter for the internal program of this traffic light - if available.
      Returns:
      internal program of this traffic light. null if not available

    • setCrossingState

      public void setCrossingState​(TrafficLight.TrafficLightState crossingState)
      Sets the given state to field "crossingState". This can be used to record the current light state. Value can be retrieved by getCrossingState() in case e.g. the steering car has driven through this traffic light.
      Parameters:
      crossingState - traffic light state

    • getCrossingState

      public TrafficLight.TrafficLightState getCrossingState()
      Gets the value of field "crossingState". Make sure to set this value before using "setCrossingState()".
      Returns:
      value of of field "crossingState"

    • getTimeSinceLastStateChange

      public long getTimeSinceLastStateChange()
      Returns the elapsed time since the beginning o fthe current state
      Returns:
      time since beginning of the state (in ms)
